problem_text_en:
Sol is having fun playing with water in two tanks. Tank $X$ has a base of area of $200 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}$.
Tank $Y$ has a base of area $100 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}$ and height $7 \mathrm{~cm}$. Sol has partly filled Tank X to a depth of $5 \mathrm{~cm}$. He then places Tank Y, which is empty, on the bottom of Tank X. The water in Tank X rises, of course, and spills over into in Tank Y. What level does the water reach in Tank Y ? <image1> A. $1 \mathrm{~cm}$
 B. $2 \mathrm{~cm}$
 C. $3 \mathrm{~cm}$
 D. $4 \mathrm{~cm}$
 E. $5 \mathrm{~cm}$
